newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia has to wait for jobless to fall - govt.
newsitem.headline: Australia has to wait for jobless to fall - govt.

text.p: Australian Employment Minister Amanda Vanstone said on Wednesday Australia will have to wait for unemployment to come down.
"...One of the worst aspects of coming into government is that Australia has this very high structural unemployment," Vanstone told Australian Broadcasting Corp radio.
"Regrettably, there isn't a magic wand that we can pull out of the top drawer and that means, regrettably, we are going to have to wait."
Vanstone said the government had put in place a series of measures to boost employment, including labour market reforms and incentives for small business.
Australia's unemployment rate has been stuck at or above 8.5 percent since the conservative Liberal-National government was elected in March 1996.
Unemployment rose to 8.8 percent in May but fell back marginally to 8.5 percent in June.
